natural problem:
What is the value of $$
(3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1
$$ when $x=4$?
natural solution: Since \begin{align} (3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1 &=(3x-2)(4x+1-4x)+1 \\ &=(3x-2) \cdot 1 +1 =3x-1, \end{align} when $x=4$ we have the value $3 \cdot 4 -1 =\boxed{11}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 4"
shows  "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * 4 * x + 1 = 11"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of $$
(3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1
$$ when $x=4$? The final Answer is 11
 ### Proof
 Since \begin{align} (3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1 &=(3x-2)(4x+1-4x)+1 \\ &=(3x-2) \cdot 1 +1 =3x-1, \end{align} when $x=4$ we have the value $3 \cdot 4 -1 =\boxed{11}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 4"
shows  "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * 4 * x + 1 = 11"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given that $x = 4$, find the value of $(3x - 2)(4x + 1) - (3x - 2)4x + 1$. The final answer is 11.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * 4 * x + 1"
and h1 : "x = 4"
shows  "P x = 11"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of $$
(3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1
$$ when $x=4$? The final Answer is 11
 ### Proof
 Since \begin{align} (3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1 &=(3x-2)(4x+1-4x)+1 \\ &=(3x-2) \cdot 1 +1 =3x-1, \end{align} when $x=4$ we have the value $3 \cdot 4 -1 =\boxed{11}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * 4 * x + 1"
and h1 : "x = 4"
shows  "P x = 11"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Given the function $P(x) = (3x - 2)(4x + 1) - (3x - 2)(4x) + 1$, find the value of $P(4)$. The final answer is $11$.
